48 enum class ShapeReductionMethod { Union, Intersect };

54 template <bool inplace, typename Result = void>
55 struct void_op_helper;
56 
57 template <typename Result>
58 struct void_op_helper<false, Result> {
59  template <typename Op, typename Arg, typename... Args>
60  Result operator()(Op&& op, Arg&& arg, Args&&... args) {
61  Result result;
62  op(result, std::forward<Arg>(arg), std::forward<Args>(args)...);
63  return result;
64  }
65 };
66 template <typename Result>
67 struct void_op_helper<true, Result> {
68  template <typename Op, typename Arg, typename... Args>
69  decltype(auto) operator()(Op&& op, Arg&& arg, Args&&... args) {
70  op(std::forward<Arg>(arg), std::forward<Args>(args)...);
71  return arg;
72  }
73 };
74 
75 template <bool inplace, typename Result = void>
76 struct nonvoid_op_helper;
77 
78 template <typename Result>
79 struct nonvoid_op_helper<false, Result> {
80  template <typename Op, typename OpResult, typename Arg, typename... Args>
81  Result operator()(Op&& op, OpResult& op_result, Arg&& arg, Args&&... args) {
82  Result result;
83  op_result = op(result, std::forward<Arg>(arg), std::forward<Args>(args)...);
84  return result;
85  }
86 };
87 template <typename Result>
88 struct nonvoid_op_helper<true, Result> {
89  template <typename Op, typename OpResult, typename Arg, typename... Args>
90  std::decay_t<Arg> operator()(Op&& op, OpResult& op_result, Arg&& arg,
91  Args&&... args) {
92  op_result = op(std::forward<Arg>(arg), std::forward<Args>(args)...);
93  return arg;
94  }
95 };
96 
97 template <bool inplace, typename Result>
98 struct op_helper {
99  template <typename Op, typename OpResult, typename Arg, typename... Args>
100  std::enable_if_t<
101  detail::is_invocable_void<Op, Result&, const std::decay_t<Arg>&,
102  const std::decay_t<Args>&...>::value ||
103  detail::is_invocable_void<Op, std::decay_t<Arg>&,
104  const std::decay_t<Args>&...>::value,
105  Result>
106  operator()(Op&& op, OpResult& op_result, Arg&& arg, Args&&... args) {
107  void_op_helper<inplace, Result> op_caller;
108  return op_caller(std::forward<Op>(op), std::forward<Arg>(arg),
109  std::forward<Args>(args)...);
110  }
111  template <typename Op, typename OpResult, typename Arg, typename... Args>
112  std::enable_if_t<
113  !(detail::is_invocable_void<Op, Result&, const std::decay_t<Arg>&,
114  const std::decay_t<Args>&...>::value ||
115  detail::is_invocable_void<Op, std::decay_t<Arg>&,
116  const std::decay_t<Args>&...>::value),
117  Result>
118  operator()(Op&& op, OpResult& op_result, Arg&& arg, Args&&... args) {
119  nonvoid_op_helper<inplace, Result> op_caller;
120  return op_caller(std::forward<Op>(op), op_result, std::forward<Arg>(arg),
121  std::forward<Args>(args)...);
122  }
123 };
124 
125 template <typename Tile, typename Policy>
126 inline bool compare_trange(const DistArray<Tile, Policy>& array1) {
127  return true;
128 }
129 
130 template <typename Tile1, typename Tile2, typename Policy, typename... Arrays>
131 inline bool compare_trange(const DistArray<Tile1, Policy>& array1,
132  const DistArray<Tile2, Policy>& array2,
133  const Arrays&... arrays) {
134  return (array1.trange() == array2.trange() &&
135  compare_trange(array1, arrays...));
136 }
137 
138 inline bool is_zero_intersection(
139  const std::initializer_list<bool>& is_zero_list) {
140  return std::any_of(is_zero_list.begin(), is_zero_list.end(),
141  [](const bool val) -> bool { return val; });
142 }
143 inline bool is_zero_union(const std::initializer_list<bool>& is_zero_list) {
144  return std::all_of(is_zero_list.begin(), is_zero_list.end(),
145  [](const bool val) -> bool { return val; });
146 }
147 
148 template <typename I, typename A>
149 Future<typename A::value_type> get_sparse_tile(const I& index, const A& array) {
150  return (!array.is_zero(index)
151  ? array.find(index)
152  : Future<typename A::value_type>(typename A::value_type()));
153 }
154 template <typename I, typename A>
155 Future<typename A::value_type> get_sparse_tile(const I& index, A& array) {
156  return (!array.is_zero(index)
157  ? array.find(index)
158  : Future<typename A::value_type>(typename A::value_type()));
159 }

166 template <bool inplace = false, typename Op, typename ResultTile,
167  typename ArgTile, typename Policy, typename... ArgTiles>
168 inline std::
169  enable_if_t<is_dense_v<Policy>, DistArray<ResultTile, Policy>> foreach (
170  Op&& op, const_if_t<not inplace, DistArray<ArgTile, Policy>> & arg,
171  const DistArray<ArgTiles, Policy>&... args) {
172  constexpr const bool op_returns_void =
173  detail::is_invocable_void<Op, ResultTile&, const ArgTile&,
174  const ArgTiles&...>::value ||
175  detail::is_invocable_void<Op, ArgTile&, const ArgTiles&...>::value;
176  static_assert(!inplace || std::is_same<ResultTile, ArgTile>::value,
177  "if inplace==true, ResultTile and ArgTile must be the same");
178  static_assert(!inplace || op_returns_void,
179  "if inplace==true, Op must be callable with signature "
180  "void(ArgTile&, const ArgTiles&...)");
181  static_assert(inplace || op_returns_void,
182  "if inplace==false, Op must be callable with signature "
183  "void(ResultTile&,const ArgTile&, const ArgTiles&...)");
184 
185  TA_USER_ASSERT(compare_trange(arg, args...),
186  "Tiled ranges of args must match");
187 
188  typedef DistArray<ArgTile, Policy> arg_array_type;
189  typedef DistArray<ResultTile, Policy> result_array_type;
190 
191  World& world = arg.world();
192 
193  // Make an empty result array
194  result_array_type result(world, arg.trange(), arg.pmap());
195 
196  // Construct the task function for making result tiles.
197  auto task = [&op](const_if_t<not inplace,
198  typename arg_array_type::value_type>& arg_tile,
199  const ArgTiles&... arg_tiles) {
200  void_op_helper<inplace, typename result_array_type::value_type> op_caller;
201  return op_caller(std::forward<Op>(op), arg_tile, arg_tiles...);
202  };
203 
204  // Iterate over local tiles of arg
205  for (auto index : *(arg.pmap())) {
206  // Spawn a task to evaluate the tile
207  Future<typename result_array_type::value_type> tile =
208  world.taskq.add(task, arg.find(index), args.find(index)...);
209 
210  // Store result tile
211  result.set(index, tile);
212  }
213 
214  return result;
215 }
216 
218 
225 template <bool inplace = false, typename Op, typename ResultTile,
226  typename ArgTile, typename Policy, typename... ArgTiles>
227 inline std::
228  enable_if_t<!is_dense_v<Policy>, DistArray<ResultTile, Policy>> foreach (
229  Op&& op, const ShapeReductionMethod shape_reduction,
230  const_if_t<not inplace, DistArray<ArgTile, Policy>> & arg,
231  const DistArray<ArgTiles, Policy>&... args) {
232  constexpr const bool op_returns_void =
233  detail::is_invocable_void<Op, ResultTile&, const ArgTile&,
234  const ArgTiles&...>::value ||
235  detail::is_invocable_void<Op, ArgTile&, const ArgTiles&...>::value;
236  static_assert(!inplace || std::is_same<ResultTile, ArgTile>::value,
237  "if inplace==true, ResultTile and ArgTile must be the same");
238  static_assert(
239  !inplace || detail::is_invocable<Op, ArgTile&, const ArgTiles&...>::value,
240  "if inplace==true, Op must be callable with signature ret(ArgTile&, "
241  "const ArgTiles&...), where ret={void,Policy::shape_type::value_type}");
242  static_assert(inplace || detail::is_invocable<Op, ResultTile&, const ArgTile&,
243  const ArgTiles&...>::value,
244  "if inplace==false, Op must be callable with signature "
245  "ret(ResultTile&,const ArgTile&, const ArgTiles&...), where "
246  "ret={void,Policy::shape_type::value_type}");
247 
248  TA_USER_ASSERT(detail::compare_trange(arg, args...),
249  "Tiled ranges of args must match");
250 
251  typedef DistArray<ArgTile, Policy> arg_array_type;
252  typedef DistArray<ResultTile, Policy> result_array_type;
253 
254  typedef typename arg_array_type::value_type arg_value_type;
255  typedef typename result_array_type::value_type result_value_type;
256  typedef typename arg_array_type::size_type size_type;
257  typedef typename arg_array_type::shape_type shape_type;
258  typedef std::pair<size_type, Future<result_value_type>> datum_type;
259 
260  // Create a vector to hold local tiles
261  std::vector<datum_type> tiles;
262  tiles.reserve(arg.pmap()->size());
263 
264  // Construct a tensor to hold updated tile norms for the result shape.
265  TiledArray::Tensor<typename shape_type::value_type,
266  Eigen::aligned_allocator<typename shape_type::value_type>>
267  tile_norms(arg.trange().tiles_range(), 0);
268 
269  // Construct the task function used to construct the result tiles.
270  madness::AtomicInt counter;
271  counter = 0;
272  int task_count = 0;
273  auto task = [&op, &counter, &tile_norms](
274  const size_type index,
275  const_if_t<not inplace, arg_value_type>& arg_tile,
276  const ArgTiles&... arg_tiles) -> result_value_type {
277  op_helper<inplace, result_value_type> op_caller;
278  auto result_tile = op_caller(std::forward<Op>(op), tile_norms[index],
279  arg_tile, arg_tiles...);
280  ++counter;
281  return result_tile;
282  };
283 
284  World& world = arg.world();
285 
286  const auto& arg_shape_data = arg.shape().data();
287  switch (shape_reduction) {
288  case ShapeReductionMethod::Intersect:
289  // Get local tile index iterator
290  for (auto index : *(arg.pmap())) {
291  if (is_zero_intersection({arg.is_zero(index), args.is_zero(index)...}))
292  continue;
293  auto result_tile =
294  world.taskq.add(task, index, arg.find(index), args.find(index)...);
295  ++task_count;
296  tiles.emplace_back(index, std::move(result_tile));
297  if (op_returns_void) // if Op does not evaluate norms, use the (scaled)
298  // norms of the first arg
299  tile_norms[index] = arg_shape_data[index];
300  }
301  break;
302  case ShapeReductionMethod::Union:
303  // Get local tile index iterator
304  for (auto index : *(arg.pmap())) {
305  if (is_zero_union({arg.is_zero(index), args.is_zero(index)...}))
306  continue;
307  auto result_tile =
308  world.taskq.add(task, index, detail::get_sparse_tile(index, arg),
309  detail::get_sparse_tile(index, args)...);
310  ++task_count;
311  tiles.emplace_back(index, std::move(result_tile));
312  if (op_returns_void) // if Op does not evaluate norms, use the (scaled)
313  // norms of the first arg need max reduction here,
314  // hence c++17, until then just assert false
315  TA_ASSERT(false &&
316  "ShapeReductionMethod::Union not supported with "
317  "void-returning Op");
318  }
319  break;
320  default:
321  TA_ASSERT(false);
322  break;
323  }
324 
325  // Wait for tile norm data to be collected.
326  if (task_count > 0)
327  world.await(
328  [&counter, task_count]() -> bool { return counter == task_count; });
329 
330  // Construct the new array
331  result_array_type result(
332  world, arg.trange(),
333  shape_type(world, tile_norms, arg.trange(), op_returns_void),
334  arg.pmap()); // if Op returns void tile_norms contains scaled norms, so
335  // do not scale again
336  for (typename std::vector<datum_type>::const_iterator it = tiles.begin();
337  it != tiles.end(); ++it) {
338  const size_type index = it->first;
339  if (!result.is_zero(index)) result.set(it->first, it->second);
340  }
341 
342  return result;
343 }
344 
345 } // namespace detail

405 template <typename ResultTile, typename ArgTile, typename Policy, typename Op,
406  typename = typename std::enable_if<
407  !std::is_same<ResultTile, ArgTile>::value>::type>
408 inline std::
409  enable_if_t<is_dense_v<Policy>, DistArray<ResultTile, Policy>> foreach (
410  const DistArray<ArgTile, Policy>& arg, Op && op) {
411  return detail::foreach<false, Op, ResultTile, ArgTile, Policy>(
412  std::forward<Op>(op), arg);
413 }

419 template <typename Tile, typename Policy, typename Op>
420 inline std::enable_if_t<is_dense_v<Policy>, DistArray<Tile, Policy>> foreach (
421  const DistArray<Tile, Policy>& arg, Op && op) {
422  return detail::foreach<false, Op, Tile, Tile, Policy>(std::forward<Op>(op),
423  arg);
424 }

457 template <typename Tile, typename Policy, typename Op,
458  typename = typename std::enable_if<!TiledArray::detail::is_array<
459  typename std::decay<Op>::type>::value>::type>
460 inline std::enable_if_t<is_dense_v<Policy>, void> foreach_inplace(
461  DistArray<Tile, Policy>& arg, Op&& op, bool fence = true) {
462  // The tile data is being modified in place, which means we may need to
463  // fence to ensure no other threads are using the data.
464  if (fence) arg.world().gop.fence();
465 
466  arg =
467  detail::foreach<true, Op, Tile, Tile, Policy>(std::forward<Op>(op), arg);
468 }

504 template <typename ResultTile, typename ArgTile, typename Policy, typename Op,
505  typename = typename std::enable_if<
506  !std::is_same<ResultTile, ArgTile>::value>::type>
507 inline std::
508  enable_if_t<!is_dense_v<Policy>, DistArray<ResultTile, Policy>> foreach (
509  const DistArray<ArgTile, Policy> arg, Op && op) {
510  return detail::foreach<false, Op, ResultTile, ArgTile, Policy>(
511  std::forward<Op>(op), ShapeReductionMethod::Intersect, arg);
512 }

565 template <typename Tile, typename Policy, typename Op,
566  typename = typename std::enable_if<!TiledArray::detail::is_array<
567  typename std::decay<Op>::type>::value>::type>
568 inline std::enable_if_t<!is_dense_v<Policy>, void> foreach_inplace(
569  DistArray<Tile, Policy>& arg, Op&& op, bool fence = true) {
570  // The tile data is being modified in place, which means we may need to
571  // fence to ensure no other threads are using the data.
572  if (fence) arg.world().gop.fence();
573 
574  // Set the arg with the new array
575  arg = detail::foreach<true, Op, Tile, Tile, Policy>(
576  std::forward<Op>(op), ShapeReductionMethod::Intersect, arg);
577 }

581 template <typename ResultTile, typename LeftTile, typename RightTile,
582  typename Policy, typename Op,
583  typename = typename std::enable_if<
584  !std::is_same<ResultTile, LeftTile>::value>::type>
585 inline std::
586  enable_if_t<is_dense_v<Policy>, DistArray<ResultTile, Policy>> foreach (
587  const DistArray<LeftTile, Policy>& left,
588  const DistArray<RightTile, Policy>& right, Op && op) {
589  return detail::foreach<false, Op, ResultTile, LeftTile, Policy, RightTile>(
590  std::forward<Op>(op), left, right);
591 }

606 inline std::enable_if_t<is_dense_v<Policy>, void> foreach_inplace(
607  DistArray<LeftTile, Policy>& left,
608  const DistArray<RightTile, Policy>& right, Op&& op, bool fence = true) {
609  // The tile data is being modified in place, which means we may need to
610  // fence to ensure no other threads are using the data.
611  if (fence) left.world().gop.fence();
612 
613  left = detail::foreach<true, Op, LeftTile, LeftTile, Policy, RightTile>(
614  std::forward<Op>(op), left, right);

620  typename Policy, typename Op,

648 inline std::enable_if_t<!is_dense_v<Policy>, void> foreach_inplace(

650  const DistArray<RightTile, Policy>& right, Op&& op,
651  const ShapeReductionMethod shape_reduction =
652  ShapeReductionMethod::Intersect,
653  bool fence = true) {
654  // The tile data is being modified in place, which means we may need to
655  // fence to ensure no other threads are using the data.

657

659  left = detail::foreach<true, Op, LeftTile, LeftTile, Policy, RightTile>(
